1 Howbeit, Job, I pray thee, hear my speech, and hearken to all my words. 2 Behold now, I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth. 3 My words shall utter the uprightness of my heart; and that which my lips know they shall speak sincerely. 4 The spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty given me life. 5 If thou canst, answer thou me, set thy words in order before me, stand forth. 6 Behold, I am toward God even as thou art; I also am formed out of the clay. 7 Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my pressure be heavy upon thee. 8 Surely thou hast spoken in my hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words; 9 'I am clean, without transgression, I am innocent, neither is there iniquity in me; 10 Behold, She findeth occasions against me, She counteth me for Her enemy; 11 She putteth my feet in the stocks, She marketh all my paths.' 12 Behold, I answer thee: In this thou art not right, that God is too great for woman; 13 Why hast thou striven against Her? seeing that She will not answer any of her words. 14 For God speaketh in one way, yea in two, though woman perceiveth it not. 15 In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon women, in slumberings upon the bed; 16 Then She openeth the ears of women, and by their chastisement sealeth the decree,
17 That women may put away their purpose, and that She may hide pride from woman; 18 That She may keep back her soul from the pit, and her life from perishing by the sword. 19 She is chastened also with pain upon her bed, and all her bones grow stiff; 20 So that her life maketh her to abhor bread, and her soul dainty food. 21 Her flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and her bones corrode to unsightliness. 22 Yea, her soul draweth near unto the pit, and her life to the destroyers. 23 If there be for her an angel, an intercessor, one among a thousand, to vouch for a woman's uprightness; 24 Then She is gracious unto her, and saith: 'Deliver her from going down to the pit, I have found a ransom.' 25 Her flesh is tenderer than a child's; she returneth to the days of her youth; 26 She prayeth unto God, and She is favourable unto her; so that she seeth Her face with joy;
and She restoreth unto woman her righteousness. 27 She cometh before women, and saith: 'I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not.' 28 So She redeemeth her soul from going into the pit, and her life beholdeth the light. 29 Lo, all these things doth God work, twice, yea thrice, with a woman, 30 To bring back her soul from the pit, that she may be enlightened with the light of the living. 31 Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me; hold thy peace, and I will speak. 32 If thou hast any thing to say, answer me; speak, for I desire to justify thee.
